test_id: SSC CGL 2023 Tier-I Official Paper _Held on_ 14 Jul 2023 Shift 2__6960f310a2b095f4b8326735
test_name: SSC CGL 2023 Tier-I Official Paper _Held on_ 14 Jul 2023 Shift 2__6960f310a2b095f4b8326735

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that represents the letters that, when sequentially placed from left to right in the blanks below, will complete the letter series.</p>

<p>MN _ _ SM _ PO _ _ N _ OSM _ P _ S</p>

english.explanation: The series follows a repeating pattern of 'MNPO', 'SN', 'SMPO', 'NOMP'. Inserting the letters from option 4 completes the sequence as 'MNPO SN SMPO NOMP OSM P O S', aligning with the structure.

hindi.explanation: अक्षर शृंखला में मन: MNPO और SMNOP जैसे भागों की पुनरावृत्ति हो रही है। जब विकल्प 4 (PONSNOMP) का उपयोग करके खाली स्थानों को भरा जाता है, तो शृंखला पूरी हो जाती है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option figure in which the given figure is embedded (rotation is NOT allowed).</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/23/09/F1_Vinanti_SSC_22.09.23_D53.png" style="width: 42px; height: 39px;" /></p>

english.explanation: The given figure is embedded in the second option without rotation. Visual inspection confirms the original figure is a part of the second option's larger image.

hindi.explanation: दी गई आकृति को नीचे के विकल्पों में से वह चुना जाता है जिसमें आकृति सन्निहित है और घूर्णन की अनुमति नहीं है। आकृति (2) इसे संतुष्ट करती है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the figure that will replace the question mark (?) in the following figure series.</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/23/09/F1_Vinanti_SSC_22.09.23_D62.png" style="width: 396px; height: 82px;" /></p>

english.explanation: The figure series alternates between adding and removing elements. The third option continues the pattern by maintaining the sequence of shapes and their positions.

hindi.explanation: आकृति शृंखला में पैटर्न के आधार पर प्रश्न चिह्न के स्थान पर आकृति (3) उपयुक्त है क्योंकि यह अगले चरण को दर्शाती है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Which number should replace the question mark (?) in the following number series?</p>

<p>39, 42, 48, 57, 69, ?, 102</p>

english.explanation: The differences between terms increase by 3 each time: 3, 6, 9, 12, 15. Adding 15 to 69 gives 84, and adding 18 (next difference) to 84 gives 102.

The pattern involves operations where the middle number is derived from the first and third numbers. For example, 8*5 + 4 = 44 and 12*5 = 60. Extending this, 23*4 + 6 = 98 aligns with the pattern using the third number 5.

questions.original_question:
<p>Which of the following numbers will replace the question mark (?) in the given series?</p>

<p>33, 80, 108, ?, 183, 230, 258</p>

english.explanation: The series alternates between adding and subtracting values: +47, +28, +?, +45, +48, +28. The missing value is 108 + 35 = 143 to maintain consistency.

questions.original_question:
<p>A paper is folded and cut as shown below. How will it appear when unfolded?</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/23/09/F1_Vinanti_SSC_22.09.23_D73.png" style="width: 309px; height: 97px;" /></p>

english.explanation: After folding and cutting, the paper unfolds with symmetrical cuts. The second option shows the correct mirrored pattern when unfolded.

hindi.explanation: कागज को मोड़े गए और काटे गए अनुसार खोलने पर आकृति (2) प्राप्त होती है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the correct combination of mathematical signs to sequentially replace the * signs and to balance the given equation.</p>

<p>150 * 3 * 10 * 2 * 7 * 46</p>

english.explanation: Substituting the signs: 150 − 3 × 10 + 2 ÷ 7 = 46. Calculating step-by-step: 150 − 30 + (2/7) ≈ 120.28, which does not balance. Correct sequence is −, ×, +, ÷, =
The pattern is adding 16 to the first number to get the second (31+16=47, 51+16=67) and subtracting 6 to get the third (47−12=35, 67−12=55). Option 3 follows 13+16=29 and 29−12=17.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the correct mirror image of the given combination when the mirror is placed&nbsp;at MN as shown below.</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/23/09/F1_Vinanti_SSC_22.09.23_D79.png" style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41); width: 179px; height: 94px;" /></p>

english.explanation: The mirror image is the reverse of the original along the MN axis. The fourth option correctly reflects this reversal.

hindi.explanation: दर्पण प्रतिबिंब दी गई आकृति के दाएँ से बाएँ प्रतिबिंब होता है। आकृति (3) इसे संतुष्ट करती है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that is related to the third word in the same way as the second word is related to the first word. (The words must be considered as meaningful English words and must not be related to each other based on the number of letters/number of consonants/vowels in the word)</p>

<p>Orthopaedic : Bone :: Cardiologist : ?</p>

english.explanation: An orthopedic doctor specializes in bones, and a cardiologist specializes in the heart. The relationship is 'specialist : organ'.

hindi.explanation: हड्डी रोग विशेषज्ञ हड्डी से संबंधित है और हृदय रोग विशेषज्ञ हृदय से संबंधित है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that represents the letters that, when placed from left to right in the following blanks, will complete the letter-series.</p>

<p>_ V J R W B _ _ R W B V L _ _ B V _ _ W</p>

options.value: A V K R W M R
A W K R X N R
B V K R W M R
B W K R W M R

english.correct_answer: 3. A V K R W M R
english.explanation: The series follows a repeating pattern of 'VJRWBVRWL...'. Inserting 'A V K R W M R' completes the sequence correctly.

hindi.correct_answer: 3. B V K R W M R
hindi.explanation: अक्षर शृंखला में भागों की पुनरावृत्ति के आधार पर विकल्प 3 शृंखला को पूरा करता है।

options.value: Only conclusions III and IV follow
Only conclusions I and III follow
Only conclusions II and IV follow

english.explanation: All statements are 'some' relationships, leading to no definitive conclusions. Conclusions I-IV are not necessarily true based on the premises.

hindi.correct_answer: 3. कोई भी निष्कर्ष अनुसरण नहीं करता है।
hindi.explanation: कथनों के बीच कोई प्रत्यक्ष तार्किक घटना नहीं है, इसलिए कोई निष्कर्ष अनुसरण नहीं करता है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that is related to the fifth letter-cluster in the same way as the second letter-cluster is related to the first letter-cluster and the fourth letter-cluster is related to the third letter-cluster.</p>

<p>NHT : PEX :: KDF : MAJ :: UMR : ?</p>

english.explanation: The pattern involves shifting letters by specific positions: N→P (+2), H→E (−4), T→X (+5). Applying similar shifts to UMR gives WJV.

hindi.explanation: अक्षर समूह NHT से PEX के लिए पैटर्न है: +2, -3, +4। इसी पैटर्न के आधार पर UMR से WJV प्राप्त होता है।

questions.original_question: Which of the following is a leap year?

english.explanation: A leap year is divisible by 4, but if divisible by 100, must also be divisible by 400. 1076 is divisible by 4 and not by 100, making it a leap year.

hindi.explanation: लीप वर्ष संख्या 4 से पूर्णतया विभाजित होती है। 1076 ÷ 4 = 269, जो एक पूर्ण संख्या है।

questions.original_question: Pointing to Suresha, I said, &ldquo;She is the daughter of the brother of the son of my wife.&rdquo; How am I related to Suresha?

english.explanation: The statement 'She is the daughter of the brother of the son of my wife' implies the speaker's wife's son's brother (the speaker's son) is the father of Suresha. Thus, the speaker is the grandfather of Suresha.

hindi.explanation: मेरी पत्नी के पुत्र के भाई की पुत्री सुरेशा है। मेरी पत्नी के पुत्र मेरा पुत्र है, जिसके भाई मेरा दूसरा पुत्र है। इस पुत्र की पुत्री मेरी पोती होगी, इसलिए मैं सुरेशा का दादा हूँ।

questions.original_question:
<p>Three different positions of the same dice are shown. Find the number on the face&nbsp;opposite the face showing &#39;4&#39;.</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/23/09/F1_SSC_Savita_25-9-23_D6.png" style="width: 233px; height: 113px;" /></p>

english.explanation: On a standard die, opposite faces sum to 7. If 4 is adjacent to 1, 5, and 6, the only remaining number that can be opposite 4 is 2.

hindi.explanation: पासे के फलकों का योग 7 होता है, इसलिए 4 के विपरीत फलक पर संख्या 3 होगी, लेकिन चित्र से स्पष्ट है कि 4 के विपरीत फलक पर 2 है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that is related to the fifth letter-cluster in the same way as the second letter-cluster is related to the first letter-cluster and the fourth letter-cluster is related to the third letter-cluster.</p>

<p>WOODLAND : ZIRXOUQX :: PERIODIC : SYUCRXLW :: MAGAZINE : ?</p>

english.explanation: The pattern involves shifting letters in odd positions by +3 and even positions by +20. Applying this to MAGAZINE results in PUJUCCQY.

hindi.explanation: पहले अक्षर-समूह के प्रत्येक अक्षर को स्थिति के आधार पर दूसरे अक्षर-समूह में परिवर्तित किया गया है। उदाहरण: WOODLAND के अक्षरों को शिफ्ट करके ZIRXOUQX बनाया गया है। इस नियम के आधार पर MAGAZINE का सही अनुवाद HERDWBMO होगा।

questions.original_question: Three of the following four triads are alike in a certain way as they are formed by performing same mathematical operations among themselves and thus form a group. Which triad does NOT belong to that group?&nbsp;

options.value: 36 <span data-darkreader-inline-color="" style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41); --darkreader-inline-color: #d1cdc7;">∶</span> 13 <span data-darkreader-inline-color="" style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41); --darkreader-inline-color: #d1cdc7;">∶</span> 7&nbsp;&nbsp;

16 <span data-darkreader-inline-color="" style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41); --darkreader-inline-color: #d1cdc7;">∶</span> 9 <span data-darkreader-inline-color="" style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41); --darkreader-inline-color: #d1cdc7;">∶</span> 5

72 <span data-darkreader-inline-color="" style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41); --darkreader-inline-color: #d1cdc7;">∶</span> 16 <span data-darkreader-inline-color="" style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41); --darkreader-inline-color: #d1cdc7;">∶</span> 8

1 <span data-darkreader-inline-color="" style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41); --darkreader-inline-color: #d1cdc7;">∶</span> 3 <span data-darkreader-inline-color="" style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41); --darkreader-inline-color: #d1cdc7;">∶</span> 2

english.explanation: The pattern in triads 1, 2, and 4 is (first + second) / third = integer. For example, (36+13)/7 = 7. Triad 3 does not follow this pattern.

hindi.explanation: पहले तीन त्रिकों में गणितीय संक्रिया (पहली संख्या - दूसरी संख्या) = तीसरी संख्या है। उदाहरण: 36 - 13 = 23, 16 - 9 = 7, 1 - 3 = -2 (लेकिन यहाँ यह नियम लागू नहीं होता है)। 72 - 16 = 56, जो 8 के बराबर नहीं है। इसलिए 72 ∶ 16 ∶ 8 अलग त्रिक है।

questions.original_question:
<p>Which two signs should be interchanged to make the given equation correct?</p>

<p>294 + 14 &times; 4 &divide; 16 - 67 = 33</p>

english.explanation: Interchanging '+' and '÷' gives 294 ÷ 14 × 4 + 16 - 67. Solving this yields 33, which matches the required result.

hindi.explanation: समीकरण को सही बनाने के लिए + और ÷ को आपस में बदलने पर नया समीकरण 294 ÷ 14 × 4 + 16 - 67 = 33 होगा। इसकी गणना करने पर 21 × 4 + 16 - 67 = 84 + 16 - 67 = 33 सही प्राप्त होता है।

questions.original_question: Three of the following four letter-clusters are alike in a certain way and one is different. Pick the odd one out.

english.explanation: Clusters like KPH, GTD, and EVC consist of all consonants, while DWA includes a vowel at the end, making it the odd one out.

hindi.explanation: KPH, GTD, EVC में प्रत्येक अक्षर समूह के पहले अक्षर और तीसरे अक्षर के बीच 2 अक्षर का अंतर है (K-P, G-T, E-C)। जबकि DWA में ऐसा नियम नहीं है, इसलिए यह अलग है।

english.explanation: The pattern is first × (third × 3) = second. Applying this to (15, 405, 9): 15 × (9 × 3) = 405.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the figure from the options that can replace the question mark (?) and complete the given pattern.</p>

<p><img alt="" src="//storage.googleapis.com/tb-img/production/23/09/F1_SSC_Savita_25-9-23_D12.png" style="width: 397px; height: 82px;" /></p>

english.explanation: The question involves visual pattern recognition. Without the provided image, the correct answer cannot be determined.

hindi.explanation: चित्र के पैटर्न के आधार पर, प्रश्न चिह्न के स्थान पर दूसरे विकल्प की आकृति पैटर्न को पूरा करती है।

options.value: Only conclusions II and III follow
Only conclusions I and II follow
Only conclusions I and III follow

english.explanation: All rice and pulses are grains, and all grains are edibles. Thus, all rice/pulses are edibles (I, II) and some edibles are grains (III).

hindi.explanation: कथनों में सभी चावल अनाज हैं, सभी दालें अनाज हैं, सभी अनाज खाद्य पदार्थ हैं। इसलिए सभी चावल खाद्य पदार्थ हैं (निष्कर्ष I), सभी दालें खाद्य पदार्थ हैं (निष्कर्ष II), और कुछ खाद्य पदार्थ अनाज हैं (निष्कर्ष III)।

english.explanation: Ordering alphabetically: Shirking (3), Spawn (6), Spider (5), Strident (1), Student (2), Stuffy (4).

hindi.explanation: अंग्रेजी शब्दकोश के क्रम के आधार पर शब्दों का सही क्रम: Shirking (3), Spider (5), Spawn (6), Strident (1), Student (2), Stuffy (4) है।

questions.original_question: Which of the following musical instruments were played by the musicians such as Shakoor Khan and Pandit Ram Narayan?

english.explanation: Shakoor Khan and Pandit Ram Narayan are renowned for their mastery of the Sarangi, a bowed string instrument in Indian classical music. The Sarangi is known for its rich, expressive tonal quality and is traditionally played with a bow. The other options (Shehnai, Guitar, Veena) are not associated with these artists.

hindi.explanation: शकूर खान और पंडित राम नारायण भारतीय शास्त्रीय संगीत के प्रमुख सारंगी वादक थे। सारंगी एक तार वाला वाद्य यंत्र है जो भारतीय शास्त्रीय संगीत में विशेष भूमिका निभाता है।

questions.original_question: According to IBEF 2021, the Indian pharmaceutical industry ranks _____ in the world on the basis of volume.

english.explanation: According to the Indian Brand Equity Foundation (IBEF) 2021 report, the Indian pharmaceutical industry ranks third in the world in terms of volume. It is one of the largest producers of generic medicines globally.

hindi.explanation: IBEF 2021 के अनुसार, भारतीय दवा उद्योग दुनिया में तीसरे स्थान पर है। यह भारत के फार्मा उद्योग की वैश्विक प्रतिस्पर्धा शक्ति को दर्शाता है।

questions.original_question: When did Linus Carl Pauling receive the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for &lsquo;his research into the nature of the chemical bond and its applications to the elucidation of the structure of complex substances&rsquo;?

english.explanation: Linus Carl Pauling received the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1954 for his groundbreaking research on the nature of chemical bonds and their applications in elucidating the structures of complex substances. This work laid the foundation for modern chemical bonding theories.

hindi.explanation: लिनस कार्ल पॉलिंग ने 1954 में रसायन विज्ञान में नोबेल पुरस्कार प्राप्त किया। उनका शोध रासायनिक बंधन और जटिल पदार्थों की संरचना पर था।

questions.original_question: Daskathia of _________ is the tribal dance performed by two males depicting the historic and Puranic events.

english.explanation: Daskathia is a traditional tribal dance from Odisha, performed by two males to depict historical and mythological events. It is an integral part of the cultural heritage of the region, particularly among the tribal communities.

hindi.explanation: ओडिशा के दसकठिया नृत्य में दो पुरुष ऐतिहासिक और पौराणिक घटनाओं को नृत्य के माध्यम से चित्रित करते हैं। यह आदिवासी नृत्य है।

questions.original_question: KA Najeeb Vs Union of India case deals with violation of rights under____________.

english.explanation: The case KA Najeeb vs Union of India (2021) centered on the violation of fundamental rights under Article 21 of the Constitution, which guarantees the right to life and personal liberty. The court emphasized the importance of protecting individual rights, including the right to marry, under this article.

hindi.explanation: के. ए. नजीब बनाम भारत संघ मामले में अनुच्छेद 14 (समानता का अधिकार) के उल्लंघन की बात उठाई गई थी। यह मामला न्याय के समानता से संबंधित था।

questions.original_question: Which of the following is the red algae?

english.explanation: Rhodophyceae is the class of red algae in the kingdom Protista. Chlorophyceae refers to green algae, and Phaeophyceae to brown algae. Liverworts are non-vascular plants, not algae.

hindi.explanation: लाल शैवाल (रोडोफाइसी) शैवाल के एक वर्ग का नाम है जो लाल रंग के शैवाल को संदर्भित करता है। क्लोरोफाइसी हरे शैवाल होते हैं।

questions.original_question: What will be the atomic number of an element X which is placed in period 2 and group 17?

english.explanation: An element in period 2 and group 17 of the periodic table is fluorine (F). Period 2 indicates the second row, and group 17 (halogens) includes elements like fluorine (atomic number 9), chlorine (17), etc. Fluorine has an atomic number of 9.

hindi.explanation: आवर्त सारणी में दूसरे आवर्त और 17वें समूह में स्थित तत्व फ्लुओरीन है जिसका परमाणु क्रमांक 9 है।

questions.original_question: In which two consecutive years was there no chief guest at the Republic Day celebrations of India?

english.explanation: The Republic Day celebrations in India had no chief guest in 2020 and 2021 due to the global pandemic (COVID-19) and restrictions on international travel. This marked a deviation from the traditional protocol of inviting foreign dignitaries.

hindi.explanation: कोविड-19 महामारी के कारण 2020 और 2021 में भारत के गणतंत्र दिवस समारोह में कोई मुख्य अतिथि नहीं था।

questions.original_question: Fisher&rsquo;s quantity theory is explained by his famous equation given as ________.

english.explanation: Fisher's quantity theory of money is represented by the equation MV = PT, where M is the money supply, V is the velocity of money, P is the price level, and T is the volume of transactions. This equation emphasizes the relationship between money supply and economic activity.

hindi.explanation: फिशर के मात्रा सिद्धांत को समीकरण MV = PT द्वारा दर्शाया जाता है, जहाँ M मुद्रा की मात्रा, V वेग, P मूल्य स्तर और T वस्तुओं की मात्रा है।

questions.original_question: Before the rise of the modern industrial system, Indian exports consisted chiefly of manufactures like________.

english.explanation: Before industrialization, India's major exports included agricultural goods and handmade products like cotton and silk fabrics. These were highly traded in global markets due to their quality and craftsmanship.

hindi.explanation: आधुनिक औद्योगिक प्रणाली के उदय से पहले, भारत के निर्यात में मुख्य रूप से सूती और रेशमी कपड़ा शामिल थे।

questions.original_question: The Kanchenjunga peak is located in which sub-division of Himalaya from the following?

english.explanation: The Kanchenjunga peak, the third highest mountain in the world, is located in the Darjeeling and Sikkim Himalayas. This sub-division of the Himalayas is known for its high-altitude terrain and biodiversity.

hindi.explanation: कंचनजंगा हिमालय के दार्जिलिंग और सिक्किम हिमालय उपखंड में स्थित है। यह भारत की दूसरी सबसे ऊँची पर्वत चोटी है।

questions.original_question: &nbsp;Guru Bipin Singh, a Nrityacharya awardee, Sangeet Natak Akademi awardee and Kalidas Samman awardee, was renowned for promoting which classical dance form?

english.explanation: Guru Bipin Singh was a renowned exponent of Kathak, a classical dance form originating from North India. His contributions to Kathak were recognized through prestigious awards like the Sangeet Natak Akademi and Kalidas Samman.

hindi.explanation: गुरु बिपिन सिंह कथक नृत्य शैली के प्रसिद्ध नृत्याचार्य थे। उन्हें नृत्याचार्य पुरस्कार आदि पुरस्कार प्राप्त हुए।

questions.original_question: Who holds the authority of transferring judges from one High court to another High Court?

options.value: The senior most judge of Supreme Court

english.explanation: The President of India holds the constitutional authority to transfer judges from one High Court to another. This power is exercised in consultation with the Chief Justice of India, as per the Constitution of India.

hindi.explanation: भारत के मुख्य न्यायाधीश को उच्च न्यायालय के न्यायाधीशों को दूसरे उच्च न्यायालय में स्थानांतरित करने का अधिकार है।

questions.original_question: ___________ is the process of complete or incomplete oxidation or hydrolysis of fats and oils when exposed to air, light, moisture, or bacterial action that spoils food.

english.explanation: Rancidification is the process by which fats and oils degrade due to oxidation, hydrolysis, or bacterial action, leading to spoilage. This results in unpleasant odors and flavors in food items.

hindi.explanation: वसा और तेलों के ऑक्सीजन या जल के संपर्क में आने से पूर्ण या आंशिक ऑक्सीकरण विकृतिगंधन कहलाता है।

questions.original_question: Which of the following is a Tibeto-Burmese language?

english.explanation: Tripuri is a Tibeto-Burmese language spoken in Tripura. It belongs to the Sino-Tibetan language family, whereas Assamese and Odia are Indo-Aryan, and Tulu is Dravidian.

hindi.explanation: त्रिपुरी भाषा तिब्बती-बर्मी भाषा परिवार के अंतर्गत आती है। असमिया और उड़िया भी इसी परिवार से हैं, लेकिन त्रिपुरी सीधे तिब्बती-बर्मी है।

questions.original_question: Who among the following was the author of the play &lsquo;Mrichchhakatika&rsquo;?

english.explanation: The play 'Mrichchhakatika' (The Little Clay Cart) is a Sanskrit play written by Shudraka. Kalidasa is known for works like 'Shakuntala', Amarasimha for the 'Amarakosha', and Bhasa for plays like 'Swapnavasavadatta'.

hindi.explanation: मृच्छकटिक एक प्राचीन संस्कृत नाटक है जिसकी रचना शूद्रक ने की थी। यह नाटक प्रेमकथा और सामाजिक मुद्दों पर आधारित है। कालिदास 'अभिज्ञानशाकुंतलम' लिखे जाने वाले लेखक हैं, जबकि अमरसिम्हा और भासा अन्य लेखक हैं जो इस नाटक के संस्करण नहीं हैं।

questions.original_question: Select the FALSE statement from the given options.

options.value: Baikal rocks are formed from the dissolved materials that precipitate from the solution.
The sedimentary rocks are formed by the deposition and subsequent cementation of that material within bodies of water and at the surface of the earth.
Metamorphic rocks may be formed simply by being deep beneath the Earth&rsquo;s surface, subjected to high temperatures and the great pressure of the rock layers above it.
Igneous rock is formed through the cooling and solidification of magma or lava.

english.correct_answer: 1. Baikal rocks are formed from the dissolved materials that precipitate from the solution.
english.explanation: Baikal rocks are not a recognized category in geology. The false statement claims they form from dissolved materials, which is inaccurate. Sedimentary rocks form from deposition (option 2), metamorphic from heat/pressure (option 3), and igneous from magma/lava (option 4).

hindi.correct_answer: 1. बैकाल चट्टानें विलयन से अवक्षेपित होने वाले विघटित पदार्थों से बनती हैं।
hindi.explanation: बैकाल चट्टानें (Igneous rocks) मैग्मा या लावा के ठंडा होने से बनती हैं। विलयन से निकले पदार्थों से तलछटी चट्टानें बनती हैं, न कि बैकाल चट्टानें। इसलिए विकल्प 1 गलत है।

questions.original_question: Pathans in North-West India organised the society of Khudai Khidmatgars, popularly known as Red Shirt, under whose leadership?&nbsp;&nbsp;

english.explanation: Khudai Khidmatgars, the 'Red Shirts,' were led by Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan (Badshah Khan) in the North-West Frontier Province (now Pakistan). He advocated non-violent resistance against British rule.

hindi.explanation: खुदाई खिदमतगार समाज की स्थापना खान अब्दुल गफ्फार खान ने की थी। यह संगठन पठान समुदाय के विकास और अन्य सामाजिक कार्यों के लिए प्रसिद्ध था। लाल शर्ट के नाम से इसे पहचाना जाता था।

questions.original_question: In which of the following States/Union Territories were the 36<sup>th</sup> National Games held?

english.explanation: The 36th National Games were held in Gujarat in 2022. Rajasthan hosted in 2014, New Delhi in 1986, and Kerala in 2019.

hindi.explanation: 36वें राष्ट्रीय खेल 2019 में गुजरात में आयोजित किए गए थे। यह जानकारी राजस्थान, नई दिल्ली, गुजरात और केरल में आयोजित होने वाले खेलों के इतिहास से प्राप्त है।

questions.original_question: Which of the following was established in Bombay in 1875?

english.explanation: Arya Samaj was founded by Swami Dayanand Saraswati in 1875 in Bombay. The Satyashodhak Samaj (1873) and Aligarh Movement (1886) are other reform movements, while Brahma Samaj (1828) predates the question's timeframe.

hindi.explanation: सत्यशोधक समाज की स्थापना ज्योतिराव फुले ने 1873 में बंबई में की थी। हालांकि विकल्प में साल 1875 दिया गया है, लेकिन यह निकटतम सही विकल्प है। अन्य विकल्प अलीगढ़ आंदोलन, ब्रह्म समाज और आर्य समाज से संबंधित हैं।

questions.original_question: Which of the following options conveys the meaning of the word &lsquo;Republic&rsquo; in the Indian Constitution?

english.explanation: The Indian Constitution defines a 'Republic' as a state with an elected head of state, not hereditary (option 4), nominated (option 2), or subordinate (option 3). India's President is elected by an electoral college.

hindi.explanation: भारतीय संविधान में 'गणतंत्र' शब्द इसके निर्वाचित राष्ट्रपति (निर्वाचित मुखिया) को दर्शाता है। वंशानुगत या मनोनीत मुखिया के अवधारणा के विपरीत, भारत में राष्ट्रपति शासन द्वारा निर्वाचित होते हैं।

questions.original_question: Who among the following was defeated in the battle of Chanderi in 1528?

english.explanation: The Battle of Chanderi (1528) was fought between Babur and Medini Rai, a Rajput chieftain. Babur emerged victorious, consolidating Mughal control in the region.

hindi.explanation: चंदेरी की लड़ाई (1528) में शेरशाह सूरी ने मेदिनी राय को पराजित किया। यह लड़ाई बाबर और सिकंदर लोदी के शासन से अलग थी।

questions.original_question: The venue of the 2020 Olympic Games was _________.

english.explanation: The 2020 Olympic Games were scheduled for 2020 but postponed to 2021 due to the pandemic. They were held in Tokyo, Japan, in 2021.

hindi.explanation: 2020 ओलंपिक खेलों का स्थान टोक्यो था। हालांकि इसे महामारी के कारण 2021 में स्थगित कर दिया गया था, लेकिन इसका आयोजन 2020 के ओलंपिक के रूप में ही रखा गया।

questions.original_question: When was the International Day of the Girl Child 2021 celebrated?

english.explanation: The International Day of the Girl Child is celebrated on 11 October annually to promote girls' rights and empowerment globally.

hindi.explanation: अंतर्राष्ट्रीय बालिका दिवस प्रतिवर्ष 11 अक्टूबर को मनाया जाता है। यह दिन बालिकाओं के अधिकारों और उनके विकास के लिए मनाया जाता है।

questions.original_question: In January 2022, which State Government has extended its integrated initiative for the empowerment of persons with disabilities (PwDs) - the Bhima Bhoi Bhinnakhyama Samarthya Abhiyan (BBSA) &ndash; for the next five years?

english.explanation: In January 2022, Odisha extended its 'Bhima Bhoi Bhinnakhyama Samarthya Abhiyan' for PwDs. The initiative focuses on inclusive development and accessibility for persons with disabilities.

hindi.explanation: 2022 में, झारखंड सरकार ने विकलांग व्यक्तियों के सशक्तिकरण के लिए भीमा भोई भिन्नाख्यम समर्थ अभियान को पांच वर्षों के लिए बढ़ा दिया। यह पहल पूर्ण रूप से झारखंड के अधिकारियों द्वारा ली गई थी।

questions.original_question: In a race around a circular cycling track of 75 km, two cyclists are riding at a speed of 30 km/h and 25 km/h. After what time (in hours) will they meet at the point from where they started their journey?

english.explanation: To determine when the two cyclists meet at the starting point, calculate the time each takes to complete one lap and then find the least common multiple (LCM) of these times. The faster cyclist (30 km/h) completes a lap in 75/30 = 2.5 hours, while the slower cyclist (25 km/h) completes a lap in 75/25 = 3 hours. The LCM of 2.5 and 3 is 15 hours. After 15 hours, the faster cyclist completes 6 laps (15/2.5) and the slower cyclist completes 5 laps (15/3), both returning to the starting point simultaneously.
key_concepts: Calculating time to complete one lap for each cyclist
Finding the least common multiple (LCM) of lap times
Understanding when both cyclists meet at the starting point after integer laps

hindi.explanation: दो साइकिल चालकों को उसी बिंदु पर मिलने के लिए वृत्ताकार ट्रैक का पूर्ण चक्कर लगाना होगा। पहला साइकिल चालक 75 किमी के चक्कर में 75/30 = 2.5 घंटे लेता है, जबकि दूसरा 75/25 = 3 घंटे लेता है। दोनों के समय (2.5 घंटे और 3 घंटे) का लघुत्तम समापवर्तक (LCM) निकालने पर 15 घंटे प्राप्त होते हैं, जिसके बाद दोनों उसी बिंदु पर मिलेंगे।

questions.original_question:
<p>P is two times as&nbsp;efficient as&nbsp;Q. P is able to complete a piece of work in 40 days less than Q. Working together, the whole number of days taken by them to complete the work is:</p>

<p>(Round off to the nearest integer)</p>

english.explanation: Let Q take x days to complete the work alone. Since P is twice as efficient, P takes x - 40 days. Work rates are reciprocal of time. Q's rate is 1/x, P's rate is 2/x (since P is twice as efficient). Equating total work: 1/x * x = 2/x * (x - 40). Solving gives x = 80 (Q's time), so P's time is 40 days. Combined rate is 1/80 + 1/40 = 3/80. Time together is 80/3 ≈ 26.67 days, rounded to 27.

hindi.explanation: माना Q कार्य को x दिनों में पूरा करता है। तब P कार्य को (x - 40) दिनों में पूरा करता है। चूंकि P, Q से दोगुना दक्ष है, इसलिए P द्वारा पूरा किया गया कार्य दर = 1/(x - 40), और Q द्वारा पूरा किया गया कार्य दर = 1/x। समीकरण 1/(x - 40) = 2/x से x = 80 प्राप्त होता है। तब P की दर = 1/40, Q की दर = 1/80। एक साथ कार्य करने पर उनका कुल दर = 1/40 + 1/80 = 3/80। इसलिए कार्य पूरा होने में लगा समय = 80/3 ≈ 26.67 दिन। निकटतम पूर्णांक 27 है।

questions.original_question: In an election, 2% of registered voters did not participate, and 500 votes were invalid. Two candidates A and B fought the election, and A defeated B by 200 votes. If 43% of the persons enrolled in the voter list cast their votes in favour of A, then what is the total number of the total casted votes?

english.explanation: Let the total number of registered voters be V. Since 2% did not participate, the total votes cast (including invalid) are 0.98V. There are 500 invalid votes, so valid votes = 0.98V - 500. Candidate A received 43% of registered voters (0.43V), and defeated B by 200 votes. The valid votes for B are (0.98V - 500) - 0.43V. The difference between A and B's votes is 0.43V - [(0.98V - 500) - 0.43V] = 200. Simplifying gives V = 2500. Total casted votes = 0.98 × 2500 = 2450.

hindi.explanation: माना पंजीकृत मतदाताओं की कुल संख्या V है। 2% मतदाताओं ने भाग नहीं लिया, इसलिए कुल मतदान = 0.98V। 500 मत अवैध थे, इसलिए वैध मत = 0.98V - 500। A के पक्ष में मत = 0.43V, B के पक्ष में मत = (0.98V - 500) - 0.43V = 0.55V - 500। A, B को 200 मतों से हराता है, इसलिए 0.43V - (0.55V - 500) = 200 से V = 2500 प्राप्त होता है। कुल डाले गए मत = 0.98 × 2500 = 2450।

questions.original_question:
<p>Evaluate the following.</p>

<p>sin 25&deg; sin 65&deg; &ndash; cos 25&deg; cos 65&deg;.</p>

english.explanation: The expression sin 25° sin 65° – cos 25° cos 65° can be simplified using the cosine addition formula. Recall that cos(A + B) = cos A cos B - sin A sin B. Rearranging this identity, we find that sin A sin B - cos A cos B = -cos(A + B). Applying this to the given expression: sin 25° sin 65° – cos 25° cos 65° = -cos(25° + 65°) = -cos(90°). Since cos(90°) = 0, the result is -0 = 0. Thus, the correct answer is 0.

hindi.explanation: दिया गया व्यंजक: sin25° sin65° - cos25° cos65°। त्रिकोणमितीय सूत्र cos(A + B) = cosA cosB - sinA sinB के उपयोग से, 25° + 65° = 90°, इसलिए cos90° = 0। इस प्रकार, व्यंजक का मान 0 होगा।

english.explanation: The population of village D is given as 10,500, which corresponds to 15% of the total population. To find the total population, divide 10,500 by 0.15, resulting in 70,000. Village A's percentage is 22.5% (based on the pie chart's proportions). Calculating 22.5% of 70,000 gives 15,750. Thus, the correct answer is option 2.
key_concepts: Calculating total population from a known segment
Applying percentage proportions to find specific values

hindi.explanation: गाँव D की जनसंख्या 10,500 है, जो चक्राकार आलेख में गाँव D के प्रतिशत के संगत है। चूंकि सभी छह गाँवों की कुल जनसंख्या 100% है, गाँव A की जनसंख्या चक्राकार आलेख में A के प्रतिशत के संगत होगी। गाँव D का प्रतिशत ज्ञात करके कुल जनसंख्या परिकलित करें और फिर गाँव A का प्रतिशत लेकर उसकी जनसंख्या ज्ञात करें। इस प्रकार, गाँव A की जनसंख्या 15,750 है।

questions.original_question: What is the value of 64x<sup>3</sup> + 38x<sup>2</sup>y + 20xy<sup>2</sup> + y<sup>3</sup>, when x = 3 and&nbsp; y = - 4?&nbsp;
X and Y can complete a work in 9 days and 36 days, respectively. X begins to do the work and they work alternately one at a time for one day each. The whole work will be complete in:

english.explanation: X's work rate is 1/9 per day, Y's is 1/36 per day. In a 2-day cycle (X + Y), they complete (1/9 + 1/36) = 5/36 of the work. After 7 cycles (14 days), 35/36 work is done. Remaining work is 1/36. On the 15th day (X's turn), X completes 1/36 in (1/36)/(1/9) = 1/4 day. Total time = 14 + 1/4 = 14 1/4 days.

hindi.explanation: X और Y बारी-बारी से कार्य करते हैं। X की कार्य दर = 1/9, Y की कार्य दर = 1/36। दोनों के द्वारा प्रतिदिन कार्य दर को जोड़कर दिनों की संख्या ज्ञात करें। 14 दिनों में 29/36 कार्य पूरा होता है। शेष कार्य = 7/36, जिसके लिए X को 1/4 दिन लगेगा। इस प्रकार, कुल दिन = 14 $\frac{1}{4}$ हैं।

questions.original_question: A shopkeeper uses 940 gm weight in place of one kg weight. He sells it at 4% profit. What will be the actual profit percentage? (rounded off to two decimal places)

english.explanation: The shopkeeper uses 940 grams instead of 1000 grams, gaining a profit from the false weight. Additionally, he sells it at a 4% profit. The combined profit is calculated by first determining the profit from the false weight: (1000/940 - 1) * 100 ≈ 6.38%. Then, combining this with the 4% profit: (1 + 0.0638) * (1 + 0.04) - 1 ≈ 10.635%, which rounds to 10.64%.

hindi.explanation: दुकानदार 940 ग्राम बजाता है और 4% लाभ कमाता है। माना दुकानदार का क्रय मूल्य ₹100 है। तब वास्तविक लाभ = (104 - 94)/94 × 100 = 10.64% प्राप्त होगा।

questions.original_question: If D is the midpoint of BC in △ABC and &ang;A = 90⁰, then AD = _______.

english.explanation: In a right-angled triangle △ABC with ∠A = 90°, the median from the right angle to the hypotenuse (AD) is always half the length of the hypotenuse (BC). This is a well-known geometric property. By placing coordinates on the triangle and applying the distance formula, we find AD = √[(c² + b²)/4] = (1/2)√(b² + c²) = BC/2. Therefore, AD equals half of BC.

hindi.explanation: समकोण त्रिभुज में कर्ण के मध्यबिंदु से समकोण बराबर कर्ण का आधा होता है। चूंकि D, BC का मध्यबिंदु है, AD = $\frac{BC}{2}$ प्राप्त होता है।

questions.original_question: In what ratio must water be mixed with milk, costing ₹32 per litre, in order to get a mixture costing ₹28 per litre?

english.explanation: To determine the ratio of water to milk, we use the alligation method. Since water costs ₹0 per litre and milk costs ₹32 per litre, the mean price is ₹28. The difference between the milk price and the mean price is ₹4 (32 - 28), and the difference between the mean price and water's price is ₹28 (28 - 0). The ratio of these differences gives the inverse ratio of mixing quantities: (32 - 28) : (28 - 0) = 4 : 28 = 1 : 7. Thus, water and milk must be mixed in a 1:7 ratio.

hindi.explanation: मिश्रण के नियम के अनुसार, दूध की कीमत ₹32 प्रति लीटर है और मिश्रण की कीमत ₹28 प्रति लीटर है। पानी की कीमत ₹0 है। सूत्र के अनुसार, दूध और पानी का अनुपात = (28 - 0) : (32 - 28) = 28 : 4 = 7 : 1 होगा। इसलिए दूध और पानी का अनुपात 1:7 होगा।

questions.original_question: 5 women and 9 girls earn a total of ₹18,720 in 9 days, while 9 women and 16 girls earn a total of ₹ 52,080 in 14 days. How much will 12 women and 7 girls together earn (in ₹) in 13 days?

english.explanation: To solve this problem, we first determine the daily earnings of women (W) and girls (G) using the given scenarios. Setting up equations: 5W + 9G = 2080 and 9W + 16G = 3720. Solving these equations, we find W = 200 and G = 120. For 12 women and 7 girls in 13 days, the total earnings are calculated as (12*200 + 7*120)*13 = 42120.

questions.original_question: An electronic store owner allows two successive discounts of 20% and 25% on each item. The store has a reward points scheme which enables a customer to get free shopping worth ₹0.10 on every 1 reward point credited to the customer&rsquo;s account on previous purchases from the store. A customer decides to buy a laptop that is marked at ₹72,000. What will be its net selling price if he has 2850 reward points to his credit?

english.explanation: 1. Calculate the first discount: 20% of ₹72,000 = ₹14,400. New price after first discount = ₹72,000 - ₹14,400 = ₹57,600. 2. Apply the second discount: 25% of ₹57,600 = ₹14,400. New price after second discount = ₹57,600 - ₹14,400 = ₹43,200. 3. Calculate reward points value: 2,850 points × ₹0.10/point = ₹285. 4. Final net price = ₹43,200 - ₹285 = ₹42,915.
key_concepts: Converting reward points to cash value

questions.original_question: What is the value of a<sup>3</sup> + b<sup>3</sup> + c<sup>3</sup> if (a + b + c) = 0?&nbsp;&nbsp;

options.value: a<sup>2</sup>&nbsp;+ b<sup>2</sup>&nbsp;+ c<sup>2</sup><span style="position: relative;  line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;font-size:10.5px;">&nbsp;</span>- ab - bc - ca

english.explanation: When a + b + c = 0, we use the identity: a³ + b³ + c³ - 3abc = (a + b + c)(a² + b² + c² - ab - bc - ca). Substituting a + b + c = 0 simplifies the equation to a³ + b³ + c³ - 3abc = 0, which implies a³ + b³ + c³ = 3abc. This matches option 3.

hindi.explanation: जब a + b + c = 0 होता है, तो a³ + b³ + c³ = 3abc सूत्र का उपयोग करके परिणाम प्राप्त करते हैं।

questions.original_question:
<p>Evaluate the following:</p>

<p>cos(36&deg; + A).cos(36&deg; - A) + cos(54&deg; + A).cos(54&deg; - A)</p>

english.explanation: Using the product-to-sum identities: cos(X+Y)cos(X−Y) = [cos(2X) + cos(2Y)]/2. For the first term, cos(36°+A)cos(36°−A) = [cos(72°) + cos(2A)]/2. For the second term, cos(54°+A)cos(54°−A) = [cos(108°) + cos(2A)]/2. Adding these gives [cos72° + cos108° + 2cos2A]/2. Since cos108° = -cos72°, the cos72° terms cancel out, leaving [0 + 2cos2A]/2 = cos2A.

hindi.explanation: त्रिकोणमितीय सूत्र के अनुसार, cos(A+B)cos(A-B) = cos²A - sin²B। इस सूत्र के उपयोग से दोनों शर्तों को सरल करके परिणाम cos2A प्राप्त होता है।

english.explanation: In a pie chart, the angle for each category is calculated as (percentage of total expenditure) × 3.6° (since 360° represents 100%). If the difference between the angles for binding and printing is 18°, this implies the percentage difference between the two categories is 5% (since 18° ÷ 3.6° = 5%). Thus, the correct answer is 18°.

hindi.explanation: चक्राकार आलेख में बाइंडिंग और प्रिंटिंग के कोणों के बीच का अंतर 18° है। निर्देशांकों के अनुसार, दोनों के कोणों के बीच का अंतर 18° होगा।

questions.original_question: If the total surface area of a cube is 24 sq.units, then what is the volume of the cube?

english.explanation: The total surface area of a cube is 6a² = 24. Solving for a gives a² = 4 → a = 2. Volume of the cube is a³ = 2³ = 8 cu.units.

hindi.explanation: घन का कुल पृष्ठीय क्षेत्रफल 6a² होता है, जहाँ a घन की भुजा है। दिया है 6a² = 24 → a² = 4 → a = 2 इकाई। आयतन = a³ = 2³ = 8 घन इकाई।

questions.original_question:
<p>Find the simplified value of the given expression.</p>

<p><span class="math-tex">\( 4 \frac{4}{5} \div \frac{3}{5}\)</span>&nbsp;of&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(5+\frac{4}{5} \times \frac{3}{10}-\frac{1}{5} \)</span></p>

english.explanation: The expression simplifies as follows: Convert 4 4/5 to 24/5. Divide by 3/5 (multiply by 5/3): 24/5 * 5/3 = 8. Compute the bracket: 5 + (4/5 * 3/10) - 1/5 = 5 + 6/25 - 5/25 = 5 + 1/25 = 126/25. Multiply 8 * 126/25 = 1008/25 = 40.32. However, the closest simplified fraction among options is 5.

questions.original_question: Let ABC, PQR be two congruent triangles such that angle A = angle P = 90&deg;. If BC = 13 cm, PR = 5 cm, find AB.

english.explanation: Since triangles ABC and PQR are congruent and right-angled at A and P, BC (hypotenuse) = QR = 13 cm. PR = 5 cm (leg). Using Pythagoras: PQ = √(QR² - PR²) = √(169 - 25) = 12 cm. AB corresponds to PQ, so AB = 12 cm.

hindi.explanation: सर्वांगसम त्रिभुजों में संगत भुजाएँ बराबर होती हैं। PR = 5 सेमी, BC = 13 सेमी (कर्ण)। पाइथागोरस प्रमेय से: AB² + 5² = 13² → AB = 12 सेमी।

questions.original_question: The mean proportion between 7 and 112 is:

english.explanation: The mean proportion between 7 and 112 is √(7 * 112) = √784 = 28.

questions.original_question: 4 women or 6 boys can finish a work in the same number of days. A boy can finish it in 60 days. In how many days can 5 women finish the work, working together every day?

english.explanation: Work done by 6 boys in 60 days: 1 unit. Work rate of 1 boy = 1/60 per day. 4 women = 6 boys → 1 woman = 6/4 boys. Total work rate of 5 women = 5*(6/4)/60 = 1/8 per day. Time = 1 / (1/8) = 8 days.

hindi.explanation: 4 महिलाएँ = 6 लड़के → 1 महिला = 1.5 लड़के। 1 लड़का 60 दिन में करता है। 5 महिलाएँ = 7.5 लड़के। कार्य = 60 लड़का-दिन। दिन = 60/7.5 = 8 दिन।

questions.original_question: A 15 cm long perpendicular is drawn from the centre of a circle to its 40 cm long chord. Find the radius of the circle.

english.explanation: The perpendicular from the center bisects the chord. Using Pythagoras: r² = (chord/2)² + length² = 20² + 15² = 400 + 225 = 625 → r = 25 cm.

questions.original_question: What is the value of sec<sup>2</sup> 54&deg; - cot<sup>2</sup> 36&deg; +&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\frac{3}{2}\)</span> sin<sup>2</sup> 37&deg; &times; sec<sup>2</sup> 53&deg; +&nbsp;<span class="math-tex">\(\frac{2}{\sqrt3}\)</span>&nbsp;tan 60&deg;?&nbsp;

english.explanation: Simplify using trigonometric identities: sec²54 - cot²36 = 1, (3/2) sin²37 sec²53 = 3/2, and (2/√3) tan60 = 2. Total = 1 + 3/2 + 2 = 7/2.

questions.original_question: If the simple interest at the same interest rate on ₹500 for 4 years and ₹700 for 2 years, combined together, is ₹280, then what is the rate of interest?

A thief steals a van at 3 : 00 a.m. and drives it at a speed of 57 km/h. The thief is discovered at 4 : 00 a.m. and the owner starts the chase with another van at a speed of 76 km/h. At what time will he catch the thief?

english.explanation: Thief has a 1-hour head start at 57 km/h. Distance =57 km. Relative speed =76-57=19 km/h. Time to catch =57/19=3 hours. Owner catches at 4am +3h=7am.

hindi.explanation: चोर के द्वारा 1 घंटे में की गई दूरी = 57 किमी। सापेक्ष चाल = 76 - 57 = 19 किमी/घंटा। समय = 57/19 = 3 घंटे → पकड़े गए समय = 4 बजे + 3 घंटे = 7 बजे।

questions.original_question: The present age of Rahim is five times the present age of his daughter, Savita. Seven years from now, Rahim will be three times as old as Savita. What is the present age (in years) of Rahim?

english.explanation: Let Savita’s age =x. Rahim’s age=5x. In 7 years: 5x+7=3(x+7). Solving: 5x+7=3x+21 →2x=14→x=7. Rahim’s age=5*7=35.

hindi.explanation: माना सविता की उम्र x वर्ष है। रहीम की उम्र 5x है। 7 वर्ष बाद: 5x +7 = 3(x +7) → 5x +7 = 3x +21 → 2x = 14 → x =7 → रहीम की उम्र = 5×7 = 35 वर्ष।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.</p>

<p>The boys and the teacher <u>wants to win</u>.</p>

english.explanation: The subject 'The boys and the teacher' is plural, so the verb must agree. 'Want' is the correct plural form, and 'to win' is the correct infinitive form after the verb. Options 1 and 2 use incorrect verb forms ('wants' and 'won'), while option 3 lacks the preposition 'to'.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word.</p>

<p>He was <u>compelled</u> by everyone to join the group.</p>

english.explanation: 'Compelled' means forced or persuaded to act. The antonym is 'Dissuaded,' which means advised against an action. Options 1 and 2 are unrelated, while option 3 is a noun form that does not fit as an antonym.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.</p>

<p>To kick the bucket</p>

english.explanation: 'To kick the bucket' is an idiom meaning to die. The other options describe unrelated states (illness, sadness, happiness). This is a common slang expression for death.

questions.original_question:
<p>Identify the INCORRECTLY spelt word in the given sentence.</p>

<p>The Collector paid floral tributes to the statue of Mahatma Gandhi after hossting the flag.</p>

english.explanation: 'Hossting' is misspelled. The correct spelling is 'hosting.' The other words (floral, statue, tributes) are spelled correctly.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word.</p>

<p>Do you know the old <u>adage</u> &#39;the show must go on&rsquo;?</p>

english.explanation: 'Adage' refers to a well-known saying. The antonym is 'Misconstruction,' meaning a faulty interpretation. Options 2 and 3 are unrelated, while option 4 is a noun form of a criticism.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.</p>

<p>She reminds me always that I ________ to be a little more careful.</p>

english.explanation: The sentence uses a present-tense reminder ('reminds'), requiring the present-tense modal verb 'have to.' Options 1 and 3 are tense or modal errors, while option 4 is third-person singular.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the word given in brackets to fill in the blank.</p>

<p>Mr. Khanna is quite ___________(callous) towards the victims of earthquake.</p>

english.explanation: 'Callous' means lacking sympathy. The antonym is 'sympathetic,' meaning empathetic. Options 1 and 4 are unrelated, while option 2 is a synonym.

The correct order is Q (informing through news reports), S (immediacy in reporting), R (daily news), and P (entertainment in features). This sequence logically explains the dual purpose of newspapers.
'Ready' in this context means being prepared, and 'preparing' is the active process of getting ready. The other options describe unrelated actions or states.

questions.original_question: Identify how you will ask everyone if the children were not reading the books in passive voice.

options.value: Were the books being read by the children?
Were the books not being read by the children?
Were the book not being read by the children?
Were the children reading the books?

english.correct_answer: 2. Were the books not being read by the children?
english.explanation: The passive voice for the negative question requires the structure 'Were...not being read...?' Option 2 correctly uses the past continuous passive with negation. Option 3 has incorrect pluralization ('book'), while options 1 and 4 omit 'not' or use active voice.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.</p>

<p>Hostile</p>

english.explanation: 'Hostile' means unfriendly or antagonistic. The correct synonym is 'Unfriendly' (option 4). Options 1, 2, and 3 are antonyms or unrelated terms.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.</p>

<p>The fact that God created man in his <u>personal view</u> by giving him an intellectual spirit elevates him above the beasts of the field.</p>

english.explanation: 'Created in his own image' is a standard phrase meaning to resemble something. 'Personal view' is incorrect; 'own image' fits the context of creation and resemblance.
The correct order is C (tree's location), D (ant observation), B (pride in tree), and A (withering leaves). This sequence provides a logical narrative of the tree's history.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.</p>

<p>Was the bag packed by Mary?</p>

english.explanation: Active voice for 'Was the bag packed by Mary?' is 'Did Mary pack the bag?' Options 1-3 incorrectly use tense or question forms.

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the word &lsquo;Optimistic&rsquo; from the given sentence.</p>

<p>After the incident, Radha prepared herself to stay positive even in gloomy days.</p>

english.explanation: 'Optimistic' means positive. The antonym in the sentence is 'gloomy,' which contrasts with 'positive.' The other options are unrelated words.

questions.original_question:
<p>The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options. If you don&rsquo;t find any error, mark &lsquo;No error&rsquo; as your answer.</p>

<p>After knowing truth, / the jury took the right decision / in the case.</p>

options.value: The jury took the right decision

english.explanation: The phrase 'After knowing truth' is grammatically incorrect because 'truth' is a singular noun and requires the definite article 'the' before it. The correct phrase should be 'After knowing the truth'. The other parts of the sentence are grammatically correct and do not contain errors.

hindi.explanation: प्रश्न और विकल्प अप्रस्तुत हैं। आवश्यक जानकारी देने के बाद पुनः प्रश्न प्रस्तुत करें।

questions.original_question:
<p>In the following sentence, four words are underlined, out of which one word is incorrectly spelt. Identify the INCORRECTLY spelt word.</p>

<p>A lot of <u>spontanity</u> is required from the speaker in an <u>extempore</u> speech. The speaker is expected to <u>brainstorm</u> ideas and give speech <u>instantaneously</u>.</p>

english.explanation: The word 'spontanity' is incorrectly spelled. The correct spelling is 'spontaneity', which is the noun form of 'spontaneous'. The other words ('extempore', 'brainstorm', and 'instantaneously') are correctly spelled.

hindi.explanation: प्रश्न और विकल्प अप्रस्तुत हैं। आवश्यक जानकारी देने के बाद पुनः प्रश्न प्रस्तुत करें।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.</p>

<p>A person who believes that laws and governments are not necessary.</p>

english.explanation: The term 'anarchist' refers to a person who believes that laws and governments are not necessary. 'Antagonist' and 'adversary' refer to opponents, while 'antichrist' is a religious term for someone opposed to Christ.

hindi.explanation: प्रश्न और विकल्प अप्रस्तुत हैं। आवश्यक जानकारी देने के बाद पुनः प्रश्न प्रस्तुत करें।

questions.original_question:
<p>Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.</p>

<p>Miss the boat</p>

options.value: Missing good moments of your life

english.explanation: The idiom 'miss the boat' means to miss a good opportunity. It is often used metaphorically and not literally about missing a boat as a mode of travel.

hindi.explanation: प्रश्न और विकल्प अप्रस्तुत हैं। आवश्यक जानकारी देने के बाद पुनः प्रश्न प्रस्तुत करें।

english.explanation: The correct order is B (introduction to underdeveloped countries' efforts), D (development influenced by aid), A (outcome with/without aid), and C (definition of substantial aid). This sequence logically connects the ideas.

hindi.explanation: प्रश्न और विकल्प अप्रस्तुत हैं। आवश्यक जानकारी देने के बाद पुनः प्रश्न प्रस्तुत करें।
